result.execSummary:
The defendant Cavotee Brown was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Business Setting <=$2500 [Modifiers: Penalty-Theft if Value <=$2500], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Cavotee Brown
parties.address: 3200 Pecan Lake Cir Apt 104, Memphis, TN 38118

parties.name: Washington County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: To be paid at the rate of $25.00 per month commencing September 1, 2016 and each 1st of the month thereafter until paid in full.  There is a $15 administrative fee for any payment plan and any change to a payment plan. The fee will be added to the first payment. If not paid, a judgment shall be entered.

Defendant shall, within three (3) days, contact the Washington County Jail for purposes of supplying a biological specimen for DNA analysis.  Defendant has the right to request expungement of DNA analysis in writing through the Department of Justice.

ADDRESS INFO for Cavotee Brown
Current: 3200 Pecan Lake Cir Apt 104, Memphis, TN 38118 United States  (Effective: 12-09-2016)
Prior: 1400 Eder La #4, West Bend, WI 53095
Documents verified with scanning; Paper file destroyed, retained electronically (scanned).

Def in person & by Atty Alyssa Armbrust.  Atty Stephanie L Hanson appeared for State.  Clerk: EZ.  State indicate restitution of $485.00 has been paid up front.  Guilty plea entered to Count 1.  Court dismissed Count 2 for read-in.  Court finds def guilty on Count 1 and orders fine of $642.00 (DNA)  to be paid at a rate of $25.00 per month commencing 9-1-16 or judgment shall be entered for nonpayment.  Defendant shall, within three (3) days, contact the Washington County Jail for purposes of supplying a biological specimen for DNA analysis.  There is a $15 administrative fee for any payment plan and any change to a payment plan. The fee will be added to the first payment. If not paid, a judgment shall be entered.
Plea hearing on July 20, 2016 at 01:15 pm.

Def in person & by Atty Alyssa Armbrust.  Atty Sandra Jo Giernoth appeared for State.  Clerk: EZ.  Counsel request adjournment for payment of up front restitution.  Plea hearing scheduled for July 20, 2016 at 01:15 pm.
Plea hearing on June 1, 2016 at 08:15 am.
Def in person & by Atty Alyssa Armbrust.  Atty Sandra Jo Giernoth appeared for State. Def. req. adj. to pay restitution  Plea hearing scheduled for June 1, 2016 at 08:15 am.
Victim does not request to be present for hearings
Plea hearing on May 4, 2016 at 08:15 am.

Def in person & by Atty Alyssa Armbrust.  Atty Mark David Bensen appeared for State.  Clerk: EZ.  Counsel request adjournment for payment of up front restitution.  Plea hearing scheduled for May 4, 2016 at 08:15 am.

Def appeared in person.  Atty Sandra Jo Giernoth for State.  Clerk: EZ.  Defendant has not met with DA office but has found employment and trying to get life back together and has not gone to the SPD.  (SPD slip provided)  Hearing scheduled for March 18, 2016 at 08:15 am.
No contact with Walmarts in Wisconsin

Def appears in custody & w/Atty Wilfred deJunco State Public Defenders Office.  Atty Mark D. Bensen for State.  Clerk: EZ.  Def given complaint, advised of charges, penalties and rights, and probable cause found.  Defendant declined representation by SPD.  Defendant does not intend to retain counsel.  State does not oppose signature bond.  Court orders $150.00 signature bond.  Def waives right to attorney.  Hearing scheduled for March 2, 2016 at 09:45 am.
